sentences.sContent: Can you raise the lamp so I can see?
sentences.sCn: 你能把灯举高点好让我看清吗？

sentences.sContent: William raised his hat and smiled at her.
sentences.sCn: 威廉抬一抬帽子，朝她笑了笑。

sentences.sContent: Raise your hand if you know the right answer.
sentences.sCn: 知道正确答案的话，请举手。

sentences.sContent: ...moving to the suburbs to raise families...
...All the traditional reasons put forward to interpret the pay gap--that women fall behind when they leave the workforce to raise kids...
...they search for new ways to raise scores...
...Charity groups organized various activities to raise money for the survivors of the earthquake...

...Many African-American blogs have written about what they’d like to see Michelle bring to the White House—mainly showing the world that a black woman can support her man and raise a strong black family...
...I thought we might try to raise a crop of potatoes...

phrases.pCn:
加剧敌对情绪;加剧紧张气氛:

The chairman's speech raised the temperature of the meeting.
主席的发言使会议的气氛顿时紧张起来。[见temperature]

words.tran: 提高（raise的过去时和过去分词）；举起

trans.tranOther: to move or lift something to a higher position, place, or level
